sub_title: Intern @GIZ | MSc IR @LSE | MSc War and Peace Studies @Leiden University | Co-Founder & Co-Editor in Chief @Young Journal of European Affairs
summary:
I am a recent graduate holding an MSc in International Relations from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), a second MSc in Crisis and Security Management (War and Peace Studies) from Leiden University, and a BA in Political Science from Ludwig-Maximilians-University in Munich. Currently, I am working with the GIZ, as part of an internship, on their Global Programme with UNHCR to foster the implementation of the HDP-Nexus in refugee aid. I am looking for job opportunities in EU politics, international security, conflict and peacebuilding and related fields starting in January 2024.

📚 My areas of experience and interest include EU foreign and security policy, international security, conflict studies and peacebuilding, climate change and security, and migration. Moreover, I have experience researching US politics, Chinese foreign policy and the work of the UN Security Council. 

📆 I have gained comprehensive experience in project development, project management, problem-solving and organising events. Examples include:
- Worked in Diversity Management Consulting at Vielfaltsprojekte GmbH 
- Co-founded, among others, the Young Journal of European Affairs, a student journal on European politics and a project on career paths in conflict regions at the German Tönissteiner Kreis e.V Student Forum.

💻 I have significant research experience in academic and non-academic contexts. Examples include:
- Distinction MSc thesis (LSE) on China's influence on EU foreign policymaking and First-class BA thesis on climate security in the UNSC
- Research for consultancy projects at Vielfaltsprojekte GmbH
- Co-authored a study on conflict of interest policies in the EU member states for the European Parliament

🌏 Having lived and studied in four European countries and worked in multinational teams, I have considerable international experience and enjoy working in a fast-paced, international environment.

school.name: The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE)

awards.title: Erasmus+ Scholarship
awards.description: Scholarship for my studies abroad at the University of Helsinki between January and May 2020.

awards.title: Scholarship at Heinrich-Böll-Foundation
awards.description: The Heinrich-Böll-Foundation is one of 13 German foundations granting scholarships to undergraduate, postgraduate and PhD students, funded largely by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research. The foundation supported my undergraduate studies at the University of Munich, my studies abroad at the University of Helsinki as well as my first master's degree at the London School of Economics and Political Science both financially and ideationally. Having been accepted as a scholarship holder in October 2019, the scholarship officially ended upon the completion of my first master's degree towards the end of 2022.

company.name: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH

profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description: In 2018, the member states of the United Nations agreed on the Global Compact for Refugees. Inspired by this commitment, the German government initiated the SUN global programme. Within its framework, GIZ and UNHCR are working together to develop and test new ways of supporting refugees and implement these strategies. The lessons learned are subsequently shared with the international community. The focus of these new solutions is on integrating the perspectives of humanitarian assistance, development, and peacebuilding (triple nexus). The project is engaged in four thematic areas: Supporting the inclusion of displaced people, promoting sustainable energy solutions, providing technical and human resources support to UNHCR, and capacity building with host governments.
profile_positions.title: Intern | Global Programme with UNHCR | Division Displacement, Migration and Return

profile_positions.description:
The Young Journal of European Affairs is a student journal in political science in which bachelor and master students can publish their academic work on the politics of the European Union after professional peer reviewing. Since our inception, we have published two annual issues, reviewed 50+ manuscripts, co-organised an academic conference, established a blog on careers in International Relations and policy analysis, established collaborations with other journals, and recruited 60+ reviewers from PhD-level to professors. We focus on EU politics from an International Relations perspective. Our publications fall mainly into the areas of European Public Policy, European Integration, European Foreign, Security and Defence Policy, European Political Economy and Global Governance Perspectives on the EU.

Responsibilities (selection):
- Developing new initiatives and cooperations with other organisations (e.g. a student conference on political participation in 2021)
- Developing professional connections with political science associations, university departments and other student journals
- Managing a team of nine and interviewing potential candidates 
- Reviewing student research papers and managing peer-reviewing processes with academics from PhD-level to professors
- Conducting interviews with IR practitioners and scholars, as well as writing pieces of policy analysis for the YJEA blog 
- Establishing contact with peer reviewers from around Europe and beyond
- Fundraising
- Publishing the journal via Open Journal Systems
- Corporate design and creation, updating and maintenance of the website
- Hiring and onboarding of new team members

Website: www.yjea.org
profile_positions.title: Co-Founder and Co-Editor in Chief

profile_positions.description:
The Young Diplomat is an organisation founded in 2018 that focuses on diplomacy and negotiation in international politics. The organisation offers training, consultancy and education, including a summer school and a winter seminar for students on the theory and practice of negotiation. The organisation focuses on making its offers accessible and providing affordable education to students.

Responsibilities (selection):
- Support the launch of the Young Diplomat Review, a magazine on international politics and diplomacy
- Research and design of a UN Security Council simulation on the China-Taiwan conflict for the Summer School 2021
- Support in implementing the Summer School 2021 in the form of moderation, technical support and chairing parts of the final simulation
- Chair of the United Nations Security Council in simulations for Leiden University and in the context of the Summer School 2021
- Supplementary research on existing simulations, for instance, on cybersecurity in the EU
profile_positions.title: Project Manager

profile_positions.description:
Vielfaltsprojekte is a social enterprise founded in 2015 focusing on anti-racism and anti-discrimination. Vielfaltsprojekte consults companies, public administration, associations and NGOs on implementing active diversity management, develops recommendations, customised team coaching and more. In addition, the company organises training, seminars, conferences, lectures, panel discussions and workshops on the topics of racism, discrimination, sexism, rejectionism, religion, migration, integration and inclusive openness. 

Responsibilities (selection):
- Research for consultancy projects in public and private organisations
- Support in the preparation and during workshops, seminars, keynote speeches and more
- Support with onboarding of new employees and interns
- Drafting press releases
- Organisation of team retreats
- Designing and updating the company's website
- Designing, writing and publishing the monthly newsletter
- Drafting Social Media posts
- Creating one of the previous versions of the corporate design
- Taking official photos during events
- Proofreading articles for newspapers and blogs
- Office organisation
profile_positions.title: Associate for Strategic Organisational Development

profile_positions.description:
Research project on "The Effectiveness of Conflict of Interest Policies in the EU-Member States" commissioned by the European Parliament, led by Prof. Dr. Christoph Demmke (University of Vaasa). 

Short Summary: "Neither instruments nor methodologies are available to measure the development of CoI over long periods of time. Therefore, it is impossible to state whether CoI increase or decrease. The Member States of the EU have no statistics and figures about the development of Conflicts of Interest (CoI). However, ever-new scandals, growing media attention and changing governance concepts create new ethical challenges and conflicts of interest. As such, detecting, managing and measuring CoI policies involve some of the greatest challenges and difficulties in legal, political, organizational, behavioural and administrative sciences. This international and empirical research examines the causes of conflicts of interest and discusses concepts, innovative instruments and new ideas on how to enhance the effectiveness of policies."

Responsibilities (selection):
- Conceptualising a questionnaire for public officials
- Literature research
- Data collection
- Data analysis/statistical analysis and interpretation
- Writing parts of the study (analytical chapter)
- Presenting the study at a joint session of the AFCO-JURI committees of the European Parliament
profile_positions.title: Co-Author/Researcher

Responsibilities (selection):
- Research and briefings on, among others, European foreign, security and defence policy, EU-China trade relations, Brexit and the Conference on the Future of Europe
- Supporting the preparation for the Federal Delegates Conference (Bielefeld)
- Supporting the preparation for the European Green Party Council (Tampere/Finland)
- Organising the deputy chairwoman's election campaign appearances in Thuringia
- Organising a trip to Croatia and Slovakia to discuss human rights and migration issues with local stakeholders
- Organising an exchange forum for Green members of state parliaments, the Bundestag and the European Parliament in Berlin

profile_positions.title: Intern at Florian Siekmann, MdL

volunteer_experiences.description: I am involved in launching a new project on careers in conflict regions. While information and support on studying and working abroad are usually readily available, this is not the case for postings in conflict regions. We aim to make information, tips and experience more accessible by interviewing experts, working with organisations in international cooperation and connecting young professionals with senior staff. Our target audience is specifically advanced students, recent graduates and young professionals. I work on fundraising, creating a podcast, a website and an online exchange forum to engage with experienced experts first-hand.

volunteer_experiences.role: Co-Founder and Co-Organiser Working Group on Foreign and Security Policy
volunteer_experiences.description: As a scholarship holder at the Heinrich-Böll-Foundation, I co-founded and coordinate the foreign and security policy working group. We organise multiple three-day-long seminars and workshops for other scholarship holders each year, focussing on general and current issues in foreign, security and defence policy. In our first year, we organised an introductory session to security policy, a United Nations Security Council simulation and a session on the Russian war in Ukraine. My tasks range from organising expert talks, preparing and giving presentations, moderating discussions and designing group work to organisational tasks like finding a venue or coordinating funding with the Heinrich-Böll-Foundation.

ApplicAid is an organisation dedicated to supporting first-generation university students in their applications for scholarships in Germany, mainly from the 13 foundations funded by the Federal Ministry of Education and Research. The aim is to make access to scholarships more equitable, including the networks and reputations coming with them. As a scholarship holder at the Heinrich-Böll-Foundation and a first-generation university student myself, I support and advise students in their application to the Böll-Foundation, especially focussing on their statement of purpose and professional/academic recommendations.

During my studies abroad at the University of Helsinki, I joined the international working groups of the Young Greens in Finland, bringing together people from all over the country in and around the capital city. I helped organise educational events on EU policy and Finnish foreign policy, like a simulation of the EU's ordinary legislative procedure.

As an elected member of the Young Green's Campaign Planning Team for the European election in Munich, I was responsible for organising the local campaign trail between January and May of 2019. This included organising, coordinating and moderating educational and skill-building events - for instance, a workshop on how to campaign, an interactive lecture on the institutional setup of the European Union and a workshop on the EU's migration policy - social events like a Pub Quiz on the EU or campaign events in public on the EU's climate policy, migration policy and social policy. In addition, we organised events with politicians from the Bavarian State Parliament.

The University of Munich (LMU) runs a peer-to-peer mentoring programme for incoming students each year. As a student mentor, I received two full days of training and supported two new students at the Department of Political Science throughout their first year, including advice on their studies, exam preparation, extracurricular engagements and more.
